revised_title: Thermomagnetic and Domain Behaviour of Silicon-Iron Single Crystals
tldr: The authors studied the thermomagnetic and domain behavior of a single crystal of silicon-iron. They measured the thermal changes accompanying magnetization and conducted Bitter figure studies to observe domain patterns. The results showed a correlation between the thermomagnetic changes and the appearance of Neel spikes and domains of reverse magnetization. The findings provide insights into the magnetic properties of silicon-iron crystals.
